title: PBSS: engine_newPayloadV2 sometimes taking over 1 minute to respond
body:
#### System information

Geth version: `1.13.2`
CL client & version: teku/v23.9.1/linux-x86_64/-privatebuild-openjdk64bitservervm-java-17
OS & Version: Linux

#### Expected behaviour

`engine_newPayload` should complete quickly, or at most timeout after 8s.


#### Actual behaviour

In some scenarios running w/ `--storage.scheme=path` I'm seeing `engine_newPayload` hang, and then `teku` resends multiple times, until eventually all of the hung requests seem to complete more or less at once:

```
Oct 11 22:34:41 ip-10-0-67-102 geth[9804]: DEBUG[10-11|22:34:41.364] Served engine_newPayloadV2               conn=127.0.0.1:55714 reqid=8265 duration=1m18.51574714s
Oct 11 22:34:41 ip-10-0-67-102 geth[9804]: DEBUG[10-11|22:34:41.365] Served engine_newPayloadV2               conn=127.0.0.1:35886 reqid=8270 duration=1m5.503575738s
Oct 11 22:34:41 ip-10-0-67-102 geth[9804]: DEBUG[10-11|22:34:41.366] Served engine_newPayloadV2               conn=127.0.0.1:51874 reqid=8272 duration=52.476870979s
Oct 11 22:34:41 ip-10-0-67-102 geth[9804]: DEBUG[10-11|22:34:41.368] Served engine_newPayloadV2               conn=127.0.0.1:52324 reqid=8275 duration=39.515087032s
Oct 11 22:34:41 ip-10-0-67-102 geth[9804]: DEBUG[10-11|22:34:41.370] Served engine_newPayloadV2               conn=127.0.0.1:45594 reqid=8279 duration=26.460411326s
Oct 11 22:34:41 ip-10-0-67-102 geth[9804]: DEBUG[10-11|22:34:41.371] Served engine_newPayloadV2               conn=127.0.0.1:34414 reqid=8281 duration=13.462109994s
Oct 11 22:34:41 ip-10-0-67-102 geth[9804]: DEBUG[10-11|22:34:41.377] Served engine_newPayloadV2               conn=127.0.0.1:39476 reqid=8283 duration=442.786115ms
Oct 11 22:34:41 ip-10-0-67-102 geth[9804]: DEBUG[10-11|22:34:41.408] Served engine_forkchoiceUpdatedV2        conn=127.0.0.1:39476 reqid=8285 duration=23.907882ms
Oct 11 22:35:23 ip-10-0-67-102 geth[9804]: DEBUG[10-11|22:35:23.004] Served engine_forkchoiceUpdatedV2        conn=127.0.0.1:34876 reqid=8297 duration="551.455Âµs"
```

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour

This only seems to happen when both the EL and CL DBs are several hours "stale" (e.g. if I sync a node to head, then shutdown the EL and CL, then make a backup of their dbs, then restore that backup (deleting the node keys) onto another machine the next day.

I suspect a similar reproduction step would be to simply shutdown the EL and CL for say 24h then start them again.

#### Backtrace

Not a backtrace per se, but w/ `--pprof` enabled I can see usually anywhere from 1 to 28 goroutines all waiting on the `newPayload` mutex, but strangely enough I don't ever see any _other_ catalyst goroutines also running (except for `heartbeat` sitting inside `time.Sleep` as expected).

Also here's the `pprof` file generated via `go tool pprof --http=:8123 -seconds 30 -nodecount=10000 http://localhost:6060/debug/pprof/profile`: https://gist.github.com/ryanschneider/e7572913b46a77b6b0b80a0b3c9064a1

We have resolved an issue recently which might be relevant with this, https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/issues/28143

Can you try to upgrade your node to latest master branch, or wait one or two days for the new release?
This should be fixed on latest release (1.13.3). It was a bug in Pebble, unfortuantely.
